|Title=Know the definition of renal colic

Renal colic is a [[Acute low back pain|lumbo-abdominal pain syndrome 270]] resulting from sudden tension in the excretory tract of the upper urinary tract upstream of an obstruction, whatever the cause. It is a [[Acute lumbar pain|lumbago 270]] homolateral to the obstruction radiating along the flank towards the external genitalia.

question.title: What is the definition of renal colic?
question.description: A sudden pain due to tension in the upper excretory tract.

option_a.title: A sharp pain in the lower back
option_a.description: A type of abdominal pain that occurs in the lower part of the back.

option_b.title: A dull ache in the flank
option_b.description: A type of pain that is felt in the side of the body, often associated with kidney stones.

option_c.title: Sudden pain due to tension in the upper excretory tract
option_c.description: The correct definition of renal colic.

option_d.title: A chronic pain in the pelvic region
option_d.description: A type of pain that persists over time and is often associated with conditions such as endometriosis.
